intro: Cleistanthus dolichophyllus, commonly known as the long-leaf cleistanthus, is a species of flowering plant in the family Euphorbiaceae. It is native to Southeast Asia, particularly found in countries like Malaysia and Indonesia. The plant is characterized by its long, narrow leaves and small, clustered yellow flowers. It typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it is not widely commercially available.
